summary: Cynthia Sue Cooper was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) from approximately October 1977 to December 1978. Payroll and certification reports document her employment, listing her name, salary, and employment dates. These records indicate her involvement with the committee during its investigation, though the specific details of her role remain unspecified in the provided documents.
significance: Medium - Cynthia Sue Cooper's significance is medium. She is identified as a staff member of the HSCA through multiple documents, indicating her involvement in the JFK assassination investigation. However, the exact nature and importance of her contributions are not detailed in the provided summaries.
